definitions.definition: To run apart ; to separate ; to tend into different directions .
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , literally , of lines or paths

definitions.definition: To become different ; to run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.
examples: Both stories start out the same way, but they diverge halfway through.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , figuratively , of interests, opinions, or anything else

definitions.definition: To separate, to tend into a different direction (from another line or path).
examples: The sidewalk runs next to the street for a few miles, then diverges from it and turns north.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , literally , of a line or path

definitions.definition: To become different , to separate (from another line or path).
examples: The software is pretty good, except for a few cases where its behavior diverges from user expectations.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , figuratively , of an interest, opinion, or anything else

definitions.definition: Not to converge : to have no limit , or no finite limit.
examples: The sequence x n = n 2 {\displaystyle x_{n}=n^{2}} diverges to infinity: that is, it increases without bound.
The sequence a n = ( − 1 ) n {\displaystyle a_{n}=(-1)^{n}} diverges ; it keeps oscillating between − 1 {\displaystyle -1} and 1 {\displaystyle 1} .
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , mathematics , of a sequence, series, or function

main_definition: ( intransitive , literally , of lines or paths ) To run apart ; to separate ; to tend into different directions .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , figuratively , of interests, opinions, or anything else ) To become different ; to run apart; to separate; to tend into different directions.
( intransitive , literally , of a line or path ) To separate, to tend into a different direction (from another line or path).
( intransitive , figuratively , of an interest, opinion, or anything else ) To become different , to separate (from another line or path).
( intransitive , mathematics , of a sequence, series, or function ) Not to converge : to have no limit , or no finite limit.
